Title: Disclosure of Information
Acceptance Criteria and Additional Notes:
Required when contractor will have access to or generate unclassified information that may be sensitive or inappropriate for public release. 
WILL NEED OESRC REVIEW.

This clause includes an exception at (a)(3) for information that is determined by the Contracting Officer to be fundamental research.
Request to Sponsor:
Negotiation Position #1 – Fundamental Research Assertion.
Virginia Tech has evaluated the scope of work proposed under this agreement and believes that information resulting from or arising during the performance of this project qualifies as fundamental research, in accordance with National Security Decision Directive 189 and the USD (AT&L) memoranda on Fundamental Research dated May 24, 2010. Virginia Tech does not anticipate that the university will have access to or generate any information that may be sensitive, proprietary, inappropriate for release to the public, or otherwise restricted for national security reasons (e.g. Covered Defense Information). Additionally, there are no known defense articles involved or defense services occurring. Virginia Tech believes this research agreement supports basic/applied research for both military and commercial applications. We respectfully request Contracting Officer written approval to authorize the fundamental research exclusion found within DFARS 252.204-7000 (a)(3) (Oct 2016). This authorization within part (a)(3) of the contract clause would remove the research dissemination controls from the agreement and allows Virginia Tech to perform fundamental research, the results of which are ordinarily published and shared broadly within the scientific community.

Negotiation Position #2 – Clause Removal
This clause is prescribed at DFARS 204.404-70(a), Additional contract clauses, for use in solicitations and contracts when the contractor will have access to or generate unclassified information that may be sensitive and inappropriate for release to the public. Virginia Tech will be executing Fundamental Research in accordance with National Security Decision Directive 189 and the USD (AT&L) memoranda on Fundamental Research dated May 24, 2010, and will not have access to or generate unclassified information that may be sensitive and inappropriate for release to the public.  Therefore, it is respectfully requested for this clause to be removed.  Thank you.

Negotiation Position #3 - Public Domain Approval using Clause's (a)(1).  This position would be used only after Negotiation Position #1 and #2 are unsuccessful.  This would require extensive coordination between OESRC and OSP.  This would typically involve a review of the CDRLs included within the contract to ensure that Block 9 is marked Distribution Statement A.
Subcontract Flowdown: Yes - in all subcontracts.  Information release requests must be submitted to the prime contractor who will submit the request to the Contracting Officer.

Title: Safeguarding of Unclassified Controlled Technical Information
Acceptance Criteria and Additional Notes:
DFARS CLAUSE WITH SIGNIFICANT RESTRICTIONS ON INFORMATION DISCLOSURE AS WELL AS SIGNIFICANT EXPORT-CONTROL IMPACTS.  NOTIFY JOHN TALERICO (OESRC) IMMEDIATELY.  

The clause requires contractors to provide "adequate security to safeguard unclassified controlled technical information from compromise."  

Sets forth security controls as specified by the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) Special Publication 800-53.  (See Table at DFARS 252.204-7012(b)).
